##This game has given me a new understanding of the plague

Micro-signal wzshck

Function description, how wonderful, this earthly life.

Click on the above material life reference Plus Star!
Material life reference

By Lu Wang
Source: Material Life Reference (ID: WZSHCK)
How important is hand washing?

Review The Standard Answer: As important as wearing a mask, and sometimes more.

After so many days of intensive bombing health education, usually again lazy people, now in the hand washing this matter are incredibly diligent, would like to wash the skin.

If you want to educate yourself about the importance of hand washing in an immersive way, I recommend playing pestilence inc. .

This is an unusual game: in other Games, players are supposed to save the world, but in pestilence, instead, we manipulate pathogens like bacteria and viruses to evolve deadly plagues that destroy the world.

In short, in this game, we are all psychopathic anti-humans.

And one of the biggest obstacles anti-human activists face when trying to destroy the world is hand washing.

After entering the game, we must first choose the difficulty level, there are simple, ordinary, difficult three modes.

Here, the first indicator of difficulty is whether people around the world like to wash their hands.

People don't like to wash their hands, so the plague is easy to spread, the simple model. Everyone washes their hands, and the plague becomes much harder to spread, which is the hard mode.

If you decide to challenge the difficult mode, then congratulations, the next difficult process will let you know very deeply: Wash hands of this simple thing, can really save the world.

Pestilence teaches us more than just washing our hands. Those who have played the game will not only be able to get a rough idea of the differences between bacteria and viruses, but will also be able to learn more about the geography of the world, and even talk about the mechanics of business promotion and the spread of rumors.

So, playing games can really improve your knowledge. I won't lie to you.
01.

After the new crown outbreak, "pestilence" is undoubtedly the most discussed game, no one.

The first was a screenshot of a "divine prophecy" that went viral on social media. This screenshot from the plague player's home-made expansion pack shows that in 2015, someone predicted "a new coronavirus by 2020" and "some similarity to SARS. ".

But along with the epidemic development, the new coronavirus's infectivity and the concealment, causes the players to ponder extremely feared.

In pestilence, the relationship between contagion and lethality is the heart of the game and the ultimate strategy.

In the game, players need to carefully control the symptoms of the plague. Initial symptoms should be as mild as possible, preferably not fatal.

On the one hand, it is to prevent people from raising their guard too early, and to speed up the development of a cure. On the other hand, if the plague's early mortality rate is too high, it will cause the host to die too soon to infect enough people.

At the same time, the plague should be as contagious as possible. The ideal scenario is to infect the world without being detected. Then it manipulates the pathogen to mutate and evolve into a rapidly deadly plague.

The infectiousness and concealment of the new coronavirus are quite in line with the routine of "quietly infecting the world and taking away all the big moves" . But the game isn't real, and plague officials are quick to warn players that the game isn't based on a scientific model of infectious disease, "suggesting players get their information directly from local or international authorities. ".

"pestilence" got a lot of attention for this outbreak, but it didn't get red hot from rubbing up against a hot spot. Since its launch in 2012, it has been a hit, making it a perennial addition to the list of most paid games.

It's hard to imagine that the game, which has been so popular for so long, was developed in his spare time by a market analyst consultant at a cost of less than $5,000.

When the game went on sale, developer James Vaughan hoped only to recoup the $5,000 investment. Now, his games have sold more than 100 million copies on various platforms. Input output is second to none.

Open the game, you can immediately feel the breath of poverty of low-cost production. There is no cool screen, the game interface is a map of the world, conveying information by the simplest text prompts.

(please ignore the level of my name)

Don't underestimate the written message. It's actually a reminder of the worst part of the plague: It's unpredictable.

Every time a plague strikes, the world is unaware. The rolling news is so peaceful that the World Health Organization is even optimistic that the human race is heading for an age of longevity.

And at the end of the game, the human race is dying, the country is collapsing, it's Psycho.

In retrospect, when we live a quiet and trivial life, the deadly plague may actually happen at any time quietly around us, but we do not know.

The game begins with the choice of the first country to be infected with the plague. Densely populated China, India, and Saudi Arabia, which has direct flights to almost anywhere in the world, can all help you get off to a good start.

This also corresponds to the heavy reality: As a large Eurasian country with a large population, China's external conditions for epidemic prevention are indeed quite unfavorable.

On the other hand, the countries with the most favorable external conditions for epidemic prevention are the island countries far away from the mainland.

Greenland, for example, three-quarters of its territory is in the Arctic Circle, isolated, sparsely populated, cold weather, is the most difficult place to infect a variety of pathogens.

So in pestilence, Greenland became known as "the light of mankind. ". Countless Times, you have infected the whole earth almost, but it is still a vast white land. Plagues kill more than 99% of the world's population, and yet less than 60,000 live in Greenland.

During the game, you will use a variety of pathogens, their characteristics will be reflected in the play.

The fungus level, for example, has made almost all the cute newbies autistic.

It's very difficult for fungi to spread over long distances, and it's very difficult for them to infect people all over the world. The most common scenario is that your fungus has managed to spread to greenland and Madagascar, but the cure is complete, Game Over.

There will also be random events, some of which will accelerate the spread of the plague, such as the often-triggered "Rio Olympics" .

Usually, people will ignore the epidemic, hold the Olympic Games as scheduled, the result will spread the plague to more countries.

It was too late to say, "they shouldn't have gone. ".

When there's a real epidemic going on, and it's almost right around the corner, revisiting pestilence is inevitably going to feel an extra weight.

It's hard to relax when the numbers on a map change. By turning off the game and returning to reality, the ever-increasing numbers of infected and dead people in the news are real people.

In the game, when you watch the human finally developed a cure, infected a large number of health, the end of the plague declared, will not lose the game as usual defeat.

Instead, you might breathe a sigh of relief and secretly hope: It would be nice if the virus was as bad as I am.

02.

A few years ago, a bug incident at World of Warcraft was a public health event in a virtual world, just as pestilence puts us in the role of bacteria and viruses to destroy humanity.

In 2005, World of Warcraft 1.7 launched a 20 person team copy. Finally, Boss has a damage ability called "fallen blood" that allows the player to continue to bleed blood for 10 seconds. "fallen blood" can be contagious, once the stroke, the side of the team and players in the game pet will be infected with continuous bleeding state.

Generally speaking, after the Boss, the player and the pet body's abnormal condition will disappear with it. But because of the bug, the "fallen blood" lurks on the player's pet and is still contagious.

When unsuspecting players return to the main city and re-release their pets, they immediately infect themselves and a large number of people. The plague of the virtual world broke out.

Most people's first reaction is to be overwhelmed. Some people in a hurry to escape the main city, but inadvertently spread the "plague" to other places. More people disregard the official advice, deliberately with the "plague" out of the city, everywhere to infect others.

At the same time, there are also well-intentioned players standing in the "epidemic area" at the door, shouting to remind other players do not rush into. Some players in the healing class form rescue teams that constantly add blood to infected players.

At the scene of a mass murder

Of course, this all takes place in virtual space, because"pestilence"and"dead"player can revive. Those who deliberately spread the "plague" are mostly out of mischief or publicity. But these scenes, still enough to reflect the real world occurred in the plague of sentient beings phase.

The "plague" , which affected about 4 million players, has drawn the interest of infectious disease researchers because of its similarities to real-life infectious diseases.

For example, like many new viruses, it was first passed from animal to human, and then from human to human via patient zero.

At one point, the World of Warcraft's operator, Blizzard Entertainment, tried something similar to a quarantine zone to stop the plague spreading, but to no avail. It's the same thing that happened in the real world with the plague. A 2006 International Monetary Fund report noted that while countries could use border closures and traffic controls, they could only slow, not stop, the spread of the disease.

Still, World of Warcraft is a game. When all else fails, the operator can fix the bug, restart the server, and the plague will be over. In the real world of public health, there is no cure 4.

03.

At a time when virtual life is so close to the real world, games are no longer just a reflection of reality. Its influence is gradually expanding offline and interacting with real world issues.

Back in 2013, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention invited plague producer James Vaughan to give a talk on how to model the spread of the plague and how the game could raise public awareness of infectious diseases.

Since then, "pestilence company" has been in the direction of educational and entertaining development. Last year, they added three new scenes, two of which are instructive.

One is "scientific denial" , aimed at the recent rise in foreign "anti-vaccine. ". This group of people, because of ignorance or superstition, against modern medicine, refused to vaccinate, not only harm themselves, but also lead to an increase in the threat of infectious diseases in their region, harm others.

The "scientific negation" scenario is set in a world dominated by anti-scientists. Scientists are exiled, the development of a cure is blocked, and even the cure developed will be destroyed. In such a world, the game went straight into super simple mode 6, one comment said.

"scientific negation" is an irony to anti-vaccines and anti-scientists, and another scenario "false news" is an irony to rumour-mongers.

In the "fake news" scenario, instead of germs and viruses, you need to play a supervillain and spread your rumors around the world.

In a sense, rumors are like a mental contagion, so they can almost seamlessly fit into the company's game system.

You can choose the type of rumor you want to spread, the source, the motivation, and as the rumor spreads, use a variety of rumor-mongering techniques: Fabrication of details, equivocation of key information, impugning the motives of the doubter, stirring up public sentiment, false "inversion" , dragging the scaremonger into endless details..

"false information" is not very difficult, but its significance lies not in the strategy skills, but in the fabrication of rumors presented in it. If you look closely, many of them look so familiar.

Whether it's disease, superstition or rumor, pestilence as a game that doesn't have an educational function of its own has given us enough knowledge and warnings.

This may be the best way to open up "virtual reality" , rather than how much money the game makes and how much it creates.

Reference:
[1] "Statement on the Current Coronavirus Outbreak", Ndemic Creations
2. Game Look, wechat account, 7 years after the list, 120 million players of plague company, developer interview

[3] L. Sydell, “'Virtual' Virus Sheds Light on Real-World Behavior”, NPR
[4] A. Marshall, “Online ‘Blood Plague’ Offers Lessons for Pandemics”, Reuters
5 Lu Xinyu: "I use the game to understand the terrible disease, "malicious full" behind the plague company is goodwill, " Appso wechat account
A group of science-loving players "forced" the plague company to add a super-simple model

* Images from the game and web pages

Click on the above material life reference Plus Star!

Material life reference

By Lu Wang

The first was a screenshot of a "divine prophecy" that went viral on social media. This screenshot from the plague player's home-made expansion pack shows that in 2015, someone predicted "a new coronavirus by 2020" and "some similarity to SARS. ".

But along with the epidemic development, the new coronavirus's infectivity and the concealment, causes the players to ponder extremely feared.

In pestilence, the relationship between contagion and lethality is the heart of the game and the ultimate strategy.

In the game, players need to carefully control the symptoms of the plague. Initial symptoms should be as mild as possible, preferably not fatal.

On the one hand, it is to prevent people from raising their guard too early, and to speed up the development of a cure. On the other hand, if the plague's early mortality rate is too high, it will cause the host to die too soon to infect enough people.

At the same time, the plague should be as contagious as possible. The ideal scenario is to infect the world without being detected. Then it manipulates the pathogen to mutate and evolve into a rapidly deadly plague.

The infectiousness and concealment of the new coronavirus are quite in line with the routine of "quietly infecting the world and taking away all the big moves" . But the game isn't real, and plague officials are quick to warn players that the game isn't based on a scientific model of infectious disease, "suggesting players get their information directly from local or international authorities. ".

"pestilence" got a lot of attention for this outbreak, but it didn't get red hot from rubbing up against a hot spot. Since its launch in 2012, it has been a hit, making it a perennial addition to the list of most paid games.

It's hard to imagine that the game, which has been so popular for so long, was developed in his spare time by a market analyst consultant at a cost of less than $5,000.

When the game went on sale, developer James Vaughan hoped only to recoup the $5,000 investment. Now, his games have sold more than 100 million copies on various platforms. Input output is second to none.

Open the game, you can immediately feel the breath of poverty of low-cost production. There is no cool screen, the game interface is a map of the world, conveying information by the simplest text prompts.

(please ignore the level of my name)

Don't underestimate the written message. It's actually a reminder of the worst part of the plague: It's unpredictable.

Every time a plague strikes, the world is unaware. The rolling news is so peaceful that the World Health Organization is even optimistic that the human race is heading for an age of longevity.

And at the end of the game, the human race is dying, the country is collapsing, it's Psycho.

In retrospect, when we live a quiet and trivial life, the deadly plague may actually happen at any time quietly around us, but we do not know.

The game begins with the choice of the first country to be infected with the plague. Densely populated China, India, and Saudi Arabia, which has direct flights to almost anywhere in the world, can all help you get off to a good start.

This also corresponds to the heavy reality: As a large Eurasian country with a large population, China's external conditions for epidemic prevention are indeed quite unfavorable.

On the other hand, the countries with the most favorable external conditions for epidemic prevention are the island countries far away from the mainland.

Greenland, for example, three-quarters of its territory is in the Arctic Circle, isolated, sparsely populated, cold weather, is the most difficult place to infect a variety of pathogens.

So in pestilence, Greenland became known as "the light of mankind. ". Countless Times, you have infected the whole earth almost, but it is still a vast white land. Plagues kill more than 99% of the world's population, and yet less than 60,000 live in Greenland.

During the game, you will use a variety of pathogens, their characteristics will be reflected in the play.

The fungus level, for example, has made almost all the cute newbies autistic.

It's very difficult for fungi to spread over long distances, and it's very difficult for them to infect people all over the world. The most common scenario is that your fungus has managed to spread to greenland and Madagascar, but the cure is complete, Game Over.

There will also be random events, some of which will accelerate the spread of the plague, such as the often-triggered "Rio Olympics" .

Usually, people will ignore the epidemic, hold the Olympic Games as scheduled, the result will spread the plague to more countries.

It was too late to say, "they shouldn't have gone. ".

When there's a real epidemic going on, and it's almost right around the corner, revisiting pestilence is inevitably going to feel an extra weight.

It's hard to relax when the numbers on a map change. By turning off the game and returning to reality, the ever-increasing numbers of infected and dead people in the news are real people.

In the game, when you watch the human finally developed a cure, infected a large number of health, the end of the plague declared, will not lose the game as usual defeat.

Instead, you might breathe a sigh of relief and secretly hope: It would be nice if the virus was as bad as I am.

02.

A few years ago, a bug incident at World of Warcraft was a public health event in a virtual world, just as pestilence puts us in the role of bacteria and viruses to destroy humanity.

In 2005, World of Warcraft 1.7 launched a 20 person team copy. Finally, Boss has a damage ability called "fallen blood" that allows the player to continue to bleed blood for 10 seconds. "fallen blood" can be contagious, once the stroke, the side of the team and players in the game pet will be infected with continuous bleeding state.

Generally speaking, after the Boss, the player and the pet body's abnormal condition will disappear with it. But because of the bug, the "fallen blood" lurks on the player's pet and is still contagious.

When unsuspecting players return to the main city and re-release their pets, they immediately infect themselves and a large number of people. The plague of the virtual world broke out.

Most people's first reaction is to be overwhelmed. Some people in a hurry to escape the main city, but inadvertently spread the "plague" to other places. More people disregard the official advice, deliberately with the "plague" out of the city, everywhere to infect others.

At the same time, there are also well-intentioned players standing in the "epidemic area" at the door, shouting to remind other players do not rush into. Some players in the healing class form rescue teams that constantly add blood to infected players.

At the scene of a mass murder

Of course, this all takes place in virtual space, because"pestilence"and"dead"player can revive. Those who deliberately spread the "plague" are mostly out of mischief or publicity. But these scenes, still enough to reflect the real world occurred in the plague of sentient beings phase.

The "plague" , which affected about 4 million players, has drawn the interest of infectious disease researchers because of its similarities to real-life infectious diseases.

For example, like many new viruses, it was first passed from animal to human, and then from human to human via patient zero.

At one point, the World of Warcraft's operator, Blizzard Entertainment, tried something similar to a quarantine zone to stop the plague spreading, but to no avail. It's the same thing that happened in the real world with the plague. A 2006 International Monetary Fund report noted that while countries could use border closures and traffic controls, they could only slow, not stop, the spread of the disease.

Still, World of Warcraft is a game. When all else fails, the operator can fix the bug, restart the server, and the plague will be over. In the real world of public health, there is no cure 4.

A few years ago, a bug incident at World of Warcraft was a public health event in a virtual world, just as pestilence puts us in the role of bacteria and viruses to destroy humanity.

In 2005, World of Warcraft 1.7 launched a 20 person team copy. Finally, Boss has a damage ability called "fallen blood" that allows the player to continue to bleed blood for 10 seconds. "fallen blood" can be contagious, once the stroke, the side of the team and players in the game pet will be infected with continuous bleeding state.

Generally speaking, after the Boss, the player and the pet body's abnormal condition will disappear with it. But because of the bug, the "fallen blood" lurks on the player's pet and is still contagious.

When unsuspecting players return to the main city and re-release their pets, they immediately infect themselves and a large number of people. The plague of the virtual world broke out.

Most people's first reaction is to be overwhelmed. Some people in a hurry to escape the main city, but inadvertently spread the "plague" to other places. More people disregard the official advice, deliberately with the "plague" out of the city, everywhere to infect others.

At the same time, there are also well-intentioned players standing in the "epidemic area" at the door, shouting to remind other players do not rush into. Some players in the healing class form rescue teams that constantly add blood to infected players.

At the scene of a mass murder

Of course, this all takes place in virtual space, because"pestilence"and"dead"player can revive. Those who deliberately spread the "plague" are mostly out of mischief or publicity. But these scenes, still enough to reflect the real world occurred in the plague of sentient beings phase.

The "plague" , which affected about 4 million players, has drawn the interest of infectious disease researchers because of its similarities to real-life infectious diseases.

For example, like many new viruses, it was first passed from animal to human, and then from human to human via patient zero.

At one point, the World of Warcraft's operator, Blizzard Entertainment, tried something similar to a quarantine zone to stop the plague spreading, but to no avail. It's the same thing that happened in the real world with the plague. A 2006 International Monetary Fund report noted that while countries could use border closures and traffic controls, they could only slow, not stop, the spread of the disease.

Still, World of Warcraft is a game. When all else fails, the operator can fix the bug, restart the server, and the plague will be over. In the real world of public health, there is no cure 4.

03.

At a time when virtual life is so close to the real world, games are no longer just a reflection of reality. Its influence is gradually expanding offline and interacting with real world issues.

Back in 2013, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention invited plague producer James Vaughan to give a talk on how to model the spread of the plague and how the game could raise public awareness of infectious diseases.

Since then, "pestilence company" has been in the direction of educational and entertaining development. Last year, they added three new scenes, two of which are instructive.

One is "scientific denial" , aimed at the recent rise in foreign "anti-vaccine. ". This group of people, because of ignorance or superstition, against modern medicine, refused to vaccinate, not only harm themselves, but also lead to an increase in the threat of infectious diseases in their region, harm others.

The "scientific negation" scenario is set in a world dominated by anti-scientists. Scientists are exiled, the development of a cure is blocked, and even the cure developed will be destroyed. In such a world, the game went straight into super simple mode 6, one comment said.

"scientific negation" is an irony to anti-vaccines and anti-scientists, and another scenario "false news" is an irony to rumour-mongers.

In the "fake news" scenario, instead of germs and viruses, you need to play a supervillain and spread your rumors around the world.

In a sense, rumors are like a mental contagion, so they can almost seamlessly fit into the company's game system.

You can choose the type of rumor you want to spread, the source, the motivation, and as the rumor spreads, use a variety of rumor-mongering techniques: Fabrication of details, equivocation of key information, impugning the motives of the doubter, stirring up public sentiment, false "inversion" , dragging the scaremonger into endless details..

"false information" is not very difficult, but its significance lies not in the strategy skills, but in the fabrication of rumors presented in it. If you look closely, many of them look so familiar.

Whether it's disease, superstition or rumor, pestilence as a game that doesn't have an educational function of its own has given us enough knowledge and warnings.

This may be the best way to open up "virtual reality" , rather than how much money the game makes and how much it creates.

Reference:
[1] "Statement on the Current Coronavirus Outbreak", Ndemic Creations
2. Game Look, wechat account, 7 years after the list, 120 million players of plague company, developer interview

[3] L. Sydell, “'Virtual' Virus Sheds Light on Real-World Behavior”, NPR
[4] A. Marshall, “Online ‘Blood Plague’ Offers Lessons for Pandemics”, Reuters
5 Lu Xinyu: "I use the game to understand the terrible disease, "malicious full" behind the plague company is goodwill, " Appso wechat account
A group of science-loving players "forced" the plague company to add a super-simple model

* Images from the game and web pages

At a time when virtual life is so close to the real world, games are no longer just a reflection of reality. Its influence is gradually expanding offline and interacting with real world issues.

Back in 2013, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention invited plague producer James Vaughan to give a talk on how to model the spread of the plague and how the game could raise public awareness of infectious diseases.

Since then, "pestilence company" has been in the direction of educational and entertaining development. Last year, they added three new scenes, two of which are instructive.

One is "scientific denial" , aimed at the recent rise in foreign "anti-vaccine. ". This group of people, because of ignorance or superstition, against modern medicine, refused to vaccinate, not only harm themselves, but also lead to an increase in the threat of infectious diseases in their region, harm others.

The "scientific negation" scenario is set in a world dominated by anti-scientists. Scientists are exiled, the development of a cure is blocked, and even the cure developed will be destroyed. In such a world, the game went straight into super simple mode 6, one comment said.

"scientific negation" is an irony to anti-vaccines and anti-scientists, and another scenario "false news" is an irony to rumour-mongers.

In the "fake news" scenario, instead of germs and viruses, you need to play a supervillain and spread your rumors around the world.

In a sense, rumors are like a mental contagion, so they can almost seamlessly fit into the company's game system.

You can choose the type of rumor you want to spread, the source, the motivation, and as the rumor spreads, use a variety of rumor-mongering techniques: Fabrication of details, equivocation of key information, impugning the motives of the doubter, stirring up public sentiment, false "inversion" , dragging the scaremonger into endless details..

"false information" is not very difficult, but its significance lies not in the strategy skills, but in the fabrication of rumors presented in it. If you look closely, many of them look so familiar.

Whether it's disease, superstition or rumor, pestilence as a game that doesn't have an educational function of its own has given us enough knowledge and warnings.

This may be the best way to open up "virtual reality" , rather than how much money the game makes and how much it creates.
